body.p: Additional Statement of facts as suggested by I. H. Reno clk

At the time Tom drew his pistol Henry declined fighting on the ground that he was unarmed when Tom said he would give up his if Henry would go to the woods or to some place which when it would not frighten the ladies which Henry declined. When we state that we give the facts as detailed by the witnesses for the Commth we do not mean to any reflection on their character for truth and veracity but my client informs me that the testimony of the witness was substantialy correct.
